vision_analysis.read_text: PS Total Fat CHEDDAR & SOUR CREAM FLAVORED CALU PER P POTATO CHIPS See Nutrition Information for Total ES OZ. (42.5 g)

estimated_calories.notes: Calories can vary based on brand, serving size, and flavorings. A typical 1-ounce (28g) serving of plain potato chips falls within this range.

macronutrient_breakdown.notes: Most of the fat is from unhealthy saturated and trans fats due to frying. Carbohydrates are primarily refined starches with minimal fiber.

key_vitamins_and_minerals.notes: Processing and frying significantly reduce the natural nutrients found in potatoes.

health_benefits.notes: Minimal benefits. The potatoes used in chips provide some potassium, but the high processing negates most nutritional value. Convenience and taste are the primary 'benefits'.

dietary_concerns: High sodium content (can exceed 10% DV per serving)

healthier_recommendations: Choose baked or air-popped chips to reduce fat content
Look for low-sodium or unsalted versions
Pair with a protein source (e.g., Greek yogurt dip) to balance macros
Portion control - pre-portion into small bowls instead of eating from the bag
Consider homemade veggie chips (sweet potato, kale) as alternatives
Opt for whole-food snacks like nuts or fresh vegetables when possible
